__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== All Bugs ===
If they deal with a distribution upgrade should be tagged so they indicate what they were trying to upgrade from and to i.e. '''feisty2gutsy''', '''edgy2feisty''' or '''dapper2edgy'''.

If they deal with an upgrade using media (CD-ROM or DVD) they should be tagged as '''cdrom-upgrade'''.

Keep an eye out for duplicates of bug <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/adept/+bug/153889|153889]]</nowiki> in Kubuntu where Gutsy indicates that a distribution upgrade is available and Feisty does not indicate that a distribution upgrade is available.

=== 79 bugs about update-manager in status "New" ===
These bugs are brand new! and have yet to be commented on by anyone.  You can be the first and we have some suggestions for courses of action below.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for the log files in '/var/log/dist-upgrade/' and set the bug to "Incomplete"  '''or'''
* If all log files are present change the status to "Confirmed" and set an importance (if you are not a QA member ask someone for help) '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found)

* Mark the bug as "Invalid" and indicate that it is invalid because it is lacking necessary information '''or'''
* Change the bug's status to "Confirmed" if the reporter replied with enough information '''or'''
* Ask a secondary follow up question and subscribe to the bug report
